result.execSummary:
All charges against Luke A Joseph in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Luke A Joseph is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luke A Joseph

records.addlTxt: for Dismissal
State's

Case called @ 1:01 PM: Defendant Luke A Joseph in court.  Attorney Wesley J Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of his right to counsel. Court entertains Defendant's voluntary waiver of counsel. Court accepts voluntary waiver of counsel. Statement by ADA Kottke regarding existing offer. ADA Kottke requests the DE reject the offer on the record if that is what he intends to do. DE rejects existing offer. Court addresses State's motion in limine, save the 906.09 motion. No objection by Defendant. Court grants State's motions. Court addresses Defendant's motion in limine, subject to State's 906.09 motion. No objection by ADA Kottke. Court grants Defense motions in limine. Court addresses Defense's motion to have DE's brother at counsel table during trial. Objection by the State. Court declines motion. Jury trial to proceed June 3, 2022.

DE is in agreement with the request for trial.  The Court requires any witness list, motions in limine or pre-trial motions be filed by no later than close of business April 18, 2021. Any response to be filed by May 6, 2022.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Luke A Joseph appeared by phone.  Attorney Wesley J Kottke appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Defendant had previously requested court appointed counsel but then declined to have an attorney. ADA Kottke does not know the status of the case since the court appointed attorney was removed from the case - offer had previously been sent to the attorney. Offer recited by ADA Kottke. DE declines to accept the offer but is open to having a PTC with the DA's office.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Luke A Joseph appeared by phone. Attorney Matthew Leusink appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. The Court has reviewed the letters submitted by DE. The defendant is requesting court appointed counsel. The Court questions the defendant regarding his income. The Court finds the defendant is eligible for court appointed counsel. Defendant to pay $250 deposit then $100 monthly for court appointed counsel. STC scheduled - NOH mailed.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on February 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant to comply with all masking requirements and security requirements when on Waushara County property.
Defendant appears via video from the WC Jail.

Case called @ 11:46 AM Defendant Luke A Joseph in court, in custody, appears via video.  Wesley J Kottke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant waives his right to counsel at this time.  NGP entered. Bond argument by ADA Kottke. Statement by DE regarding bond. Court orders $500 Sig Bond.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
